entry.title: FEW FILINGS IN SPECIAL DISTRICTS ELECTION, DEADLINE MARCH 20TH
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 4:00 a.m. Few people have filed for open seats in the Douglas County Special Districts Election as of March 3rd. Information from County Clerk Daniel Loomis said 223 positions are open. That includes seats for school districts, fire districts, park and recreation districts, sanitary districts, and more. Loomis said elections for Special...

entry.title: WINSTON CITY COUNCIL TO CONSIDER MOVING TOWARDS DISPENSARIES
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Winston City Council will consider moving towards allowing recreational marijuana dispensaries in its city limits, as part of the council agenda on Monday night. In 2015 Oregon legalized recreational dispensaries but cities and counties have the right to decide if they will allow them in their boundaries. In November...

entry.title: UMPQUA NATIONAL FOREST ANNOUNCES NEW CAMPGROUND CONCESSIONAIRE
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 3:30 a.m. The Umpqua National Forest has announced a new campground concessionaire and the reopening of campground reservations. A UNF release said WESTrek Services is now responsible for managing select campgrounds on the forest. This new five-year permit will ensure high-quality recreation experiences across the North Umpqua, Cottage Grove, and Diamond Lake...

entry.title: WYDEN ANNOUNCES OPEN-TO-ALL TOWN HALL ON TUESDAY
entry.summary: March 3, 2025 2:50 a.m. On Saturday, U.S. Senator Ron Wyden announced he will co-host a live on-line town hall Tuesday night with People’s Town Hall, to offer all Oregonians the opportunity to ask questions, share their ideas and offer their views during the State of the Union speech. entry.title: ROSEBURG HAS SECOND RECORD BREAKING HIGH IN A ROW
entry.summary: March 1, 2025 6:15 a.m. Roseburg had a record-breaking high temperature for the date on Friday. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the mercury reached 74 degrees at the Roseburg Regional Airport. The previous record high for February 28th was 71 degrees, set in...

entry.title: ATTORNEY GENERAL SECURES SETTLEMENT AGAINST PHARMACEUTICAL COMPANIES
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 10:50 a.m. Calling it a groundbreaking case, Oregon Attorney General Dan Rayfield has reached a settlement involving a monopoly on testosterone replacement gels. A release from the Department of Justice Office of the Attorney General said the $9,25 million settlement includes a $6,197,500 in disgorged profits and penalties along with attorney fees...

entry.title: Tense Standoff Ends in Peaceful Arrests; Charges Dropped for Domestic Assault
entry.summary: A tense standoff in Douglas County ended peacefully with the arrest of a man and woman after a domestic dispute. Initial assault charges were dropped, with the man facing a felony weapons charge. The case remains under review.

entry.title: HOME AND GARDEN SHOW HAPPENING FRIDAY THROUGH SUNDAY

entry.title: BOARD EXTENDS SUPERINTENDENT’S CONTRACT, APPLAUDS COMMITTMENT
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 3:30 a.m. On Wednesday, the Roseburg School Board voted to extend Superintendent Jared Cordon’s contract through June 30, 2028, citing his steadfast leadership and long-term vision for student success. A district release said the extension, which takes effect July 1st, reflects the board’s confidence in Cordon’s ability to continue driving meaningful advancements...

entry.title: REPRESENTATIVE OSBORNE MAKES STATEMENT ON OFF-ROAD VEHICLE BILL
entry.summary: February 28, 2025 3:20 a.m. On Thursday, the Oregon House of Representatives unanimously passed HB 2232A, a bill that changes the authority of creating off-road vehicle standards from the Director of Transportation and Environmental Quality Commission to the State Parks and Recreation Department.
